title: Sidewall And Border, 1740–66
provenance: From Graeme park, Governor Sir William Keith's former Malt House and country hideaway (from creditors) at County Line Road, Horsham Township, Montgomery County, Pennsylvania. Last redecoration of house was done circa 1766.
description: a) Powdering of six-pointed stars which are now black, having probably changed color from brown. Fragments of plaster indicate paper was plastered over. Joined sheets measure aproximately 19x22 inches; b) Swag border with pearls, flowers and foliage.

tombstone.epitaph: Sidewall And Border, 1740–66. Block-printed on handmade paper. Gift of Anonymous Donor. a-w-832-a,b.
